Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.notebook

Class Notebook

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tasks.model.notebook.Notebook
public class Notebook extends Object
The Notebook Class controls the creation of task lists and tasks. Methods include manipulation of tasks and task lists for the note book. Used for the GUI class to update the UI. IssueList has five fields for the notebook object, a string for the notebook name, a boolean if the notebook has been changed, and 3 lists for current list selected, list of active tasks, and a sorted list of taskLists.
Author:
Austin Warren and Brynn Reed

  • Constructor Details

    • Notebook

      public Notebook(String name)
      Constructs a Notebook with the given name. The taskLists field is constructed as a SortedList and the activeTaskList is constructed and is set to the currentTaskList. isChanged is initialized to true.
      Parameters:
      name - the string value for the notebook's name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the notebookName is null, empty, or matches ACTIVE_TASKS_NAME.

  • Method Details

    • saveNotebook

      public void saveNotebook(File file)
      Saves the current Notebook to the given file. isChanged is updated to false.
      Parameters:
      file - a file path for the notebook to be outputted to

    • getNotebookName

      public String getNotebookName()
      Standard getter method for the notebookName field, returning the name as a string
      Returns:
      a string for the note book name

    • isChanged

      public boolean isChanged()
      Standard getter method for the isChanged field, returning the boolean value
      Returns:
      a boolean for the change status of the notebook

    • setChanged

      public void setChanged(boolean value)
      Public setter method for the isChanged field, setting the boolean value
      Parameters:
      value - the boolean value for the notebook's change status

    • addTaskList

      public void addTaskList(TaskList taskList)
      The TaskList is added to the list of task lists, the current task list is updated to the new task list, and isChanged is updated to true.
      Parameters:
      taskList - a task list to be added to the list of task lists.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the new TaskList’s name is ACTIVE_TASKS_NAME or a duplicate of an existing TaskList

    • getTaskListsNames

      public String[] getTaskListsNames()
      Returns a list of task list names. The “Active Tasks” list is always listed first.
      Returns:
      a string array for the names of the task lists

    • setCurrentTaskList

      public void setCurrentTaskList(String name)
      Sets the currentTaskList to the AbstractTaskList with the given name. If a TaskList with that name is not found, then the currentTaskList is set to the activeTaskList.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the task list to be selected as the currentTaskList field

    • getCurrentTaskList

      public AbstractTaskList getCurrentTaskList()
      Standard getter method for the currentTaskList field, returning the list
      Returns:
      a AbstractTaskList for the current list to be edited

    • editTaskList

      public void editTaskList(String name)
      Method to edit the currentTaskList, by removing the list, editing it, then adding it back to the taskLists field. isChanged is updated to true.
      Parameters:
      name - the task list to be edited.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the currentTaskList is an ActiveTaskList, if the new name matches “Active Tasks” (case insensitive), or is a duplicate of the name of another TaskList (case insensitive and including if the name is the same as the list that will be renamed).

    • removeTaskList

      public void removeTaskList()
      The currentTaskList is removed and then set to the activeTaskList. isChanged is updated to true.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the currentTaskList is an ActiveTaskList

    • addTask

      public void addTask(Task task)
      If the currentTaskList is not a TaskList do nothing with the Task. If the currentTaskList is a TaskList, then add the task and check if the Task is active. If so, then you can update the activeTaskList. isChanged is updated to true.
      Parameters:
      task - the task to be added to the currentTaskList

    • editTask

      public void editTask(int idx, String name, String description, boolean recurring, boolean active)
      A Task can only be edited if the currentTaskList is a TaskList; otherwise, do nothing. If the Task can be edited, update the fields of the Task at the specified index. Check if the Task is active. If so, then you can update the activeTaskList. isChanged is updated to true.
      Parameters:
      idx - an integer value for the index of the task to be edited
      name - a string value for the name of the task to be edited
      description - a string value for the description of the task to be edited
      recurring - a boolean value for the recurring status to be edited
      active - a boolean value for the active status to be edited
